"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5438cf5d6368727a35e30000#post_5438cf5d6368727a35e30000
I could never get behind Lovecraft's writing. I will admit that it's just my opinion though. Lovecraft like to speak of human's feebleness and fragility but I can't support that kind of mentality. It my just my "naive" idealism but I think we humans kick ass and waaaaaaaaay sturdier than he gave us credit for.

topics.body:
You know I realized something; a lot of shit going on in the world in forty years will seem stupid and inconsequential because people have a massive bias towards either thinking things were either better in the past or believe that their ideals would be better for running the world and that very few people actually care about facts; rather they just want to be validated and that is why censorship exists is to circle jerk people's beliefs.

To use a extreme example what I mean is North Korea they constantly circle jerk the idea that their ideals are superior to everyone else even when right outside the main government buildings people are literally starving to death in the streets.

To use a less extreme example it's like the atheism+ movement; they believe that religion is a mental illness.


It explains the war for freedom from thought in that unfortunately far too many people don't want to allow freedom of speech or freedom of thought because they believe that their ideals are infallible and therefore are absolute no matter the situation or country.  To use a far less extreme analogy it's like the people who think every country cars should drive on the left side of the road and believes that most countries drive on the left side of the road even when directly contradicted with it.

The reason why so much shit in the past seems stupid is that the people who religiously believed the ideals all have died of old age.  Like fifty years from now the idea of a country denying same-sex marriage will seem incredibly stupid worldwide because by then the majority of people who oppose it will have all died of old age.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

You heard that right; a police officer mere miles away from Ferguson shot to death a african american teenager *BECAUSE THE TEEN HAD A SANDWICH IN HIS HANDS!*

Just god damn it.[/bq]

MÃ©xico. 43 students. One got killed by a police officer. The others were taken by them, and then nobody know nothing more about the students. Three days later, almost half of the students were found death in a hole in the middle of nowhere. People claims that the police give them to the sicarios to do what you know what they always do. 

*Yeah, the police sucks this days*...

[/bq]

they werent exactly better back in 1900 when they were killing and abusing minorities for no reason and didint had no comeuppance.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5438d27a6368726dc5570100#post_5438d27a6368726dc5570100
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5438d1b36368725668410200#post_5438d1b36368725668410200
Two words.
Ignorance and bigotry.
[/bq]
Side note: from personal experience the more someone says, "well I know everything" the more likely they are to know nothing and are just justifying their beliefs.

When you get down to it considering all the information in the world exceeds the capability for the human brain we literally know next to nothing about how the world works individually.  Sure each of us in our lifetime can either learn everything about a particular facet of the world and/or a relatively large amount compared to others, but if you had a magical machine to cram all the information about the world into someone's brain it would probably kill the person dead on the spot.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5438d011636872565c710100#post_5438d011636872565c710100
 I find some of lovecraft's concepts to be sort of comforting. The whole idea behind the yith/great race appeals to me. Beings far superior to us in every way that seek knowledge about us just as much as we may seek knowledge about them. 
They're kind of dicks about the whole mind displacement though. 

Also there's a page in the story that's just a list of more badass sounding names that the protagonist talked to while his mind was displaced. "Nug-soth, a magician of the dark conquerors of 16,000 A.D" for example. 
That's all I know about him from the story but you know some shit went down in his lifetime.
